engagementHook.title: Think About This...
engagementHook.content: Your body contains approximately 37 trillion cells - that's more than 4,000 times the number of people on Earth! Yet every single one started from just two cells. How do cells know what to become and what to do?

contentSections.title: What is a Cell?
contentSections.content:
A cell is the smallest unit of life that can carry out all the processes necessary for life. Every living thing is made of cells - from the simplest bacteria to complex multicellular organisms like humans and whales.

Cells were first discovered in 1665 by Robert Hooke when he looked at a thin slice of cork through a microscope. He saw tiny compartments that reminded him of monastery cells, hence the name 'cells.'

contentSections.title: Cell Definition
contentSections.definition: The basic structural, functional, and biological unit of all known living organisms. A cell is the smallest unit of life that can replicate independently.

contentSections.title: Cell Theory
contentSections.content: Cell theory is one of the fundamental principles of biology. It consists of three main principles:
items: All living organisms are composed of one or more cells
The cell is the basic unit of structure and organisation in organisms
All cells come from pre-existing cells (cell division)

contentSections.title: Deep Dive: The Math Behind Cell Size
contentSections.content: As a cell grows larger, its volume increases faster than its surface area. This is because:
items: Surface area increases by the square of the radius (4πr²)
Volume increases by the cube of the radius (4/3 πr³)
This means larger cells have proportionally less surface area relative to their volume, making it harder to transport materials across the membrane efficiently.

contentSections.title: Worked Example: Calculating SA:V Ratio
contentSections.content:
Problem: Calculate the surface area to volume ratio of a cube-shaped cell with sides of 2μm.

Solution:

Surface Area = 6 × side² = 6 × (2)² = 6 × 4 = 24 μm²

Volume = side³ = (2)³ = 8 μm³

SA:V Ratio = 24:8 = 3:1

The SA:V ratio is 3:1, meaning the surface area is 3 times the volume.

definitions: Cell: The basic unit of life; the smallest unit that can carry out all life processes
Cell Theory: States that all living things are made of cells, cells are the basic unit of structure, and cells come from pre-existing cells
SA:V Ratio: The ratio of surface area to volume - as cells get larger, this ratio decreases, limiting cell size
keyPoints: Cells are limited in size by their surface area to volume ratio
Prokaryotic cells lack a nucleus; eukaryotic cells have a nucleus
All cells have a cell membrane, cytoplasm, DNA, and ribosomes

multipleChoice.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the principles of cell theory?
options: All living organisms are composed of cells
Cells can spontaneously generate from non-living matter
The cell is the basic unit of structure
All cells come from pre-existing cells

multipleChoice.question: Why are cells generally small?
options: Large cells cannot fit inside organisms
Small cells are easier to see under microscopes
To maintain a high surface area to volume ratio for efficient transport

multipleChoice.question: Which structure is found in ALL cells?

shortAnswer.question: Calculate the surface area to volume ratio of a cube with sides of 4μm. Show your working.
Explain why the surface area to volume ratio limits cell size.

multipleChoice: C - High SA:V ratio allows efficient material transport
A - All cells have a cell membrane
shortAnswer: As cells increase in size, volume increases faster than surface area (cube vs square). This reduces the SA:V ratio, making it harder to transport sufficient nutrients in and waste out across the membrane.
